text: ah hi everyone height anyway tano here
the internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for a review of this new
self-titled project from the meridian
brothers and el grupa renaissimiento yes
this is the 11th full-length lp from
colombian music outfit meridian brothers
it is a crossover with el grupo
renaissimiento which i mean in the
loosest sense of the word as the
conditions of this collaboration are a
little ill-defined and purposefully so
because i guess they are a 70s salsa act
whose lyrics have focused on things like
police brutality injustice the plight of
humanity though the press release for
this record says the group came out of
myth and were created in spirit on this
record by meridian brothers so is what's
going on here merely a reference is it a
callback is it meridian brothers
imagining their own group of
collaborators and then making a record
with them like almost guerrillas style
and just kind of embodying them
themselves either way there seems to be
some theatrics at play here not just
conceptually but musically and sonically
too because handily this is some of the
strangest salsa music i think i've ever
heard the guitars and some of the
instrumentation generally comes off a
little detuned or just embracing some
very sour harmony work so even when the
band does hit a great groove on these
tracks which is often there's usually
something still a little off-putting
about it and i haven't even talked about
the vocals yet and they're something
else cause much of the singing on this
thing has a deep and kind of froggy
quality to it this is what i imagined a
salsa band would sound like if they were
trying to do a very cheeky impersonation
of one on an episode of the muppets like
40 years ago not to insinuate meridian
brothers are on purely a comedic pursuit
here they're not cause this record
actually rocks but there is a conscious
element of absurdity to many of these
tracks that adds a lot of flavor to the
recipe especially when you consider
moments like the intro la policia which
is all about the cruelty and corruption
of cops which again is an interesting
angle considering the track sounds like
it's being sung by a band of colombian
kermits the vocal work on this thing
isn't just cartoony though it's quite
skilled when it comes to the melody
choices and harmonies the vocal layers
on metamorphosis for example sound like
they're slowly deflating from bar to bar
not to mention this track is also one
about waking up to find that you are a
robot with descriptions of the world
being filled with cameras and drones and
screens it's kind of hard to tell where
this transhumanistic fantasy ends and
reality begins even stranger are the
vocal harmonies on bomba atomica which
is all about the horrors of nuclear
weaponry and as long as i'm talking
about the singing here i do have to
mention these uh i'm guessing improvised
raspy shrieks that pop in every once in
a while at random or when the band is
really cooking
[Applause]
even during more mournful moments on the
record like triste son which is a track
that seems to be all about the lingering
sadness and loneliness of depression
even describing the protagonist as going
out on a date with a girl who uh i guess
throws up at the sight of him so even
during this record's darkest moments it
can be a bit cheeky but still incredibly
catchy as most of the choruses on this
thing bang triste sun
triste song hermano
as far as the songwriting goes the
choruses the structure the melodies the
lyrical ideas they're all there the
performances on this thing are super
solid too though i wouldn't have
expected any less from meridian brothers
at this point the hand drums hit a great
clip on atomica bomba on metamorphosis
too the cool dubby echoed electric
guitars on that track are a nice touch
as well the tense chord changes on
hypnosis are the perfect soundtrack for
being mesmerized into a nightmarish trip
feels like something out of a telemundo
twilight zone episode then the closing
track takes a few liberties with a cover
of la mujer sin coroson which is a
surprisingly underwhelming moment on the
lp vocally and instrumentally in
comparison with everything else here
it's played pretty straight maybe out of
respect for the original but it still
lacks the color and eccentricity that
much of this record brings throughout
the rest of it but still there is a
funny ending to this track lyrically
that plays into this records general
themes of a futuristic dystopia making
reference to having a colombian
pacemaker for a heart and when uh
wanting a heart just getting an iphone
instead i'll say with this lp overall i
love the vast majority of the tracks on
it it does start a little stronger than
it finishes especially with discarga
prophetica not having as strong a chorus
as many other tracks here though the jam
on this one is quite fiery but
regardless of a few cuts that may pale
in comparison to others this project
still brings a lot of great songs color
personality fun meridian brothers do it
again and continue to prove why they are
one of the most interesting groups on
the latin scene right now i'm feeling a
light too decent eight on this one tran
position have you given this album a
listen did you love it did you hate it
what would you rate it you're the best
you're the best what should i review
next hit the like if you like please
subscribe and please don't cry hit the
bell as well over here next to my head
is another video that you can check out
hit that up or the link to subscribe to
the channel anthony fantano
meridian brothers
forever
